sen.j: 石川 広季（いしかわ ひろすえ、生年不詳 - 宝治2年3月4日 (旧暦)（1248年3月30日））は、鎌倉時代初期の武将。
sen.e: Hirosue ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - March 30, 1248) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 大和源氏の流れを汲む陸奥石川氏7代目当主。
sen.e: He was the seventh family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan which followed Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 兄石川重勝が多病であったため、仏門に入った父の跡を継いだ。
sen.e: Since his elder brother Shigekatsu ISHIKAWA suffered many diseases, Hirosue succeeded his father who entered the Buddhist priesthood.

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）、平家討伐の兵を挙げた源頼朝のもとへ、一族の成田光治に兵を与えて派兵する。
sen.e: He gave soldiers to Motomitsu ISHIKAWA, a member of his family, and dispatched troops to aid MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who raised an army to subjugate the Taira family.
In 1183, he ordered a member of his family, Koji NARITA, to lead troops to aid MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who raised an army to subjugate the Taira family.
sen.cmt: 年代が訳抜けています。成田光治がMotomitsu ISHIKAWAになっています。Koji NARITAと訳しました。「兵を与えて」をgaveだと本当に「与える（贈与する）」ことになるので、「兵を率いることを命じ」といったニュアンスで訳しました。
sen.e: In 1183, he ordered a member of his family, Koji NARITA, to lead troops to aid MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who raised an army to subjugate the Taira family.

sen.j: 平家滅亡の後、文治5年（1189年）、頼朝は奥州藤原氏を攻めるため、自ら大軍を率いて陸奥白河関に到った。
sen.e: After the fall of the Taira clan, Yoritomo led large forces to Shirakawa no seki (Shirakawa Barrier) in Mutsu Province to attack the Oshu-Fujiwara clan in 1189.

sen.j: 広季は病に伏せっていたため、一族の大寺光行を名代として兵を預け、頼朝を迎えさせた。
sen.e: Since Hirosue was sick, he left his army to Mitsuyuki ODERA, a member of his family, as a myodai (a substitute) to welcome Yoritomo.

sen.j: 大軍が藤田に到着すると、頼朝は源頼義が勧請した八幡宮に戦勝祈願を行う。
sen.e: When the large forces arrived at Fujita, Yoritomo prayed for a victory in Hachiman-gu Shrine which was made a branch shrine for a deity by MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi.
When the large forces arrived at Fujita, Yoritomo prayed in Hachiman-gu Shrine, which was made a branch shrine for a deity by MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi, for a victory.
sen.cmt: victory in がHachimanguにもかかって取れるため、for a victoryを文末に移動し、またwhichの前に「、」を加えました。
sen.e: When the large forces arrived at Fujita, Yoritomo prayed for a victory in Hachiman-gu Shrine, which MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi had established as a branch shrine by enshrining a deity there.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。

sen.j: この時頼朝は、石川の館の麓の河隈に明賀の松の影そ映ふ、と和歌を詠んでいる。
sen.e: At this time, Yoritomo composed a waka poem, 石川の館の麓の河隈に明賀の松の影そ映ふ (The shadow of pine trees of Meiga was mirrored on the river at the foot of the residence of Ishikawa).
sen.cmt: 「石川の館の麓の河隈に明賀の松の影そ映ふ」という詩は、石川の館の麓の河隈に明賀の松の影そ映ふ (The shadow of pine trees of Meiga was mirrored on the river at the foot of the residence of Ishikawa)としました。

sen.j: 頼朝は、奥州藤原氏を破って奥州を平定した後、志田郡の一部を八幡宮の神料として寄進、鎌倉に凱旋した。
sen.e: After Yoritomo defeated the Oshu-Fujiwara clan and conquered Oshu (Mutsu province), he donated part of Shida-gun as an offering to Hachiman-gu Shrine and triumphantly returned to Kamakura.

sen.j: 光行も石川に帰還した。
sen.e: Mitsuyuki also went back to Ishikawa.

sen.j: 建久元年（1190年）、藤原氏の旧臣大川兼遠が残党を集めて乱を起こすと、平定の軍に光行を参陣させる。
sen.e: When Kaneto OKAWA, an old retainer of the Fujiwara clan, rose in rebellion by collecting the remnants of a defeated party in 1190, Mitsuyuki was summoned to raise an army for suppression.

sen.j: 建久8年（1197年）、広季は一族の光行、矢吹光誠を伴って鎌倉で頼朝にまみえ、善光寺詣での先駆けを命じられる。
sen.e: Hirosue, Mitsuyuki and Mitsumasa YABUKI met Yorotomo in Kamakura in 1197, and were ordered to lead a visit to Zenko-ji Temple.

sen.j: 上洛し、広季は従四位下大膳大夫、光行は従五位下兵部少輔、光誠は従五位下刑部少輔にそれぞれ任じられる。
sen.e: They went up to Kyoto, and Hirosue, Mitsuyuki and Mitsumasa were assigned to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table), Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Hyobu-shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military) and Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Gyobu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Justice), respectively.

In Kyoto, Hirosue was appointed to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table), Mitsuyuki was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Hyobu-shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military) and Mitsumasa was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Gyobu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Justice).
sen.cmt: 「上洛し」＝「京都にて」と訳しました。各人の名前の後に各人の役職を続けました。
